content:
What a thoughtful gesture! Gifts that couples can share together can be a wonderful way to encourage quality time and create memories together. Here are some ideas for shared gifts that your siblings-in-law might enjoy:

1. **Experience Gift**: Give them an experience they can enjoy together, like:
	* Wine and cheese tasting (~$50-100)
	* Cooking class (~$50-100)
	* Couples massage or spa day (~$100-200)
	* Concert or show tickets (~$20-100)
	* Weekend getaway or staycation package (~$100-500)
2. **Gourmet Gift Basket**: Put together a basket filled with their favorite snacks, drinks, or treats, such as:
	* Artisanal cheeses and crackers (~$20-50)
	* Wine and champagne (~$20-100)
	* Gourmet chocolates or truffles (~$20-50)
	* Specialty teas or coffee (~$10-30)
3. **Game Night Kit**: Create a fun game night package with:
	* A board game or card game (~$10-30)
	* A puzzle or jigsaw puzzle (~$10-30)
	* A wine and cheese pairing game (~$20-50)
	* A gift card to a local game store or online retailer (~$20-50)
4. **Subscription Service**: Sign them up for a shared subscription service, such as:
	* Wine club (~$20-50/month)
	* Monthly delivery of gourmet food or snacks (~$10-30/month)
	* Streaming service or online course platform (~$10-30/month)
5. **Personalized Item**: Give them a customized item that celebrates their relationship, like:
	* Personalized cutting board or cheese board (~$20-50)
	* Engraved wine bottles or glasses (~$20-50)
	* Customized photo album or frame (~$20-50)
	* Monogrammed throw blanket or pillow (~$20-50)
6. **Tech Bundle**: Put together a bundle of tech goodies they can both use, such as:
	* A portable charger and wireless earbuds (~$20-50)
	* A smart speaker and streaming device (~$50-100)
	* A high-tech coffee maker or kitchen gadget (~$50-100)

Remember to consider your siblings-in-law's interests, preferences, and lifestyle when choosing a gift. You can always mix and match these ideas or add your own personal touch to make it extra special!
